Package org.neo4j.csv.reader

Class ThreadAheadReadable

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • org.neo4j.csv.reader.ThreadAhead
        • org.neo4j.csv.reader.ThreadAheadReadable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, Runnable, CharReadable, SourceTraceability
    public class ThreadAheadReadable
extends ThreadAhead
implements CharReadable
    Like an ordinary CharReadable, it's just that the reading happens in a separate thread, so when a consumer wants to read(SectionedCharBuffer, int) more data it's already available, merely a memcopy away.

    • Method Detail

      • read

        public SectionedCharBuffer read​(SectionedCharBuffer buffer,
                                int from)
                         throws IOException
        The one calling read doesn't actually read, since reading is up to the thread in here. Instead the caller just waits for this thread to have fully read the next buffer and flips over to that buffer, returning it.
        Specified by:
        read in interface CharReadable
        Parameters:
        buffer - SectionedCharBuffer to read new data into.
        from - index into the buffer array where characters to save (compact) starts (inclusive).
        Returns:
        a SectionedCharBuffer containing new data.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • read

        public int read​(char[] into,
                int offset,
                int length)
        Description copied from interface: CharReadable
        Reads characters into the given array starting at offset, reading length number of characters. Similar to Reader.read(char[], int, int)
        Specified by:
        read in interface CharReadable
        Parameters:
        into - char[] to read the data into.
        offset - offset to start reading into the char[].
        length - number of bytes to read maximum.
        Returns:
        number of bytes read, or 0 if there were no bytes read and end of readable is reached.

                     throws IOException
        Specified by:

      • position

        public long position()
        Specified by:
        position in interface SourceTraceability
        Returns:
        a low-level byte-like position e.g. byte offset. This position is an "uncompressed" position.

      • compressionRatio

        public float compressionRatio()
        Specified by:
        compressionRatio in interface SourceTraceability
        Returns:
        the observed compression ratio to use when compensating between situations where reported data source length is a compressed length and SourceTraceability.position() is decompressed position. Usually this value is 1.0, which means that source length and position are aligned, but in some cases e.g. for GZIP this isn't efficiently possible and therefore this ratio can be used like so: 
         actualSourceLength = position() / compressionRatio()

      • sourceDescription

        public String sourceDescription()
        Specified by:
        sourceDescription in interface SourceTraceability
        Returns:
        description of the source being read from.
